studyFeedback: I have been to meetings like those that seemed to be discussed in the article. In my organization, we tend to naturally do some of the outlined suggestions such as only inviting those relevant to the meeting. Most in our organization that would and do attend necessary meetings tend to be high performers anyway, so our main issue is meeting length. We have done too many marathons over the years, as many of us actually work quite independently from each other and departments are small, so there is some burn out from the past. We would put off meeting, but then when we did meet, there would be a lot to discuss piled up. Now we have learned to hold more regular and concise meetings to avoid this, and have been able to be much more effective and less dreading these long and tedious meetings.
